basic.description:
Intensive study in the mandate and practice of the Shaw Festival in Niagara-on-the-Lake, Ontario. Students attend several productions at the Shaw Festival, discussing these in seminars and with guest speakers drawn from the Shaw company where available.  
NOTE    Taught in Niagara-on-the-Lake during Summer Term. May be taken in conjunction with DRAM 373/3.0. There is a lab fee for this course, which includes theatre tickets. Information regarding fee and accommodation is available on the Departmental website.
basic.subject: DRAM
basic.title: Modern Drama at the Shaw Festival

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite     Level 3 and (registration in a DRAM or GNDS Major or Medial Plan, or COCA-CODR Sub-Plan, or STSC Specialization Plan) and (a grade of B- in each of DRAM200; DRAM 220; DRAM 240) and (a GPA of 2.6 in DRAM) or permission of the Department.
